meanings.definition: To write or draw hastily or carelessly
meanings.sent1: She scrawbed a quick note before rushing out the door.
meanings.sent2: The student scrawbed his answers on the test paper without much thought.
meanings.sent3: In a hurry, he scrawbed his signature on the document, barely legible.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were scrawbed across her face for all to see.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti artist scrawbed his tag on the wall in bold colors.

meanings.definition: Written or drawn hastily or carelessly
meanings.sent1: The scrawbed message on the wall was hard to decipher.
meanings.sent2: She received a scrawbed letter with no return address.
meanings.sent3: The scrawbed doodles on the notebook made her smile.
meanings.sent4: The scrawbed lines on the map led them astray.
meanings.sent5: The scrawbed sketches in the margin added a touch of whimsy to the book.
